titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Edward J. Malloy Papers and Photographs TAM.591
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicole Greenhouse

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-16T17:42-0400

change.item: Edited by Maggie Schreiner to reflect updated administrative information

did.unittitle: Edward J. Malloy Papers and Photographs

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: Edward J. Malloy (1935-2012) was a labor leader in the Enterprise Association of Steamfitters Local Union 638 United Association and the Building and Construction Trades Council of Greater New York. It contains date books, individual and group photographs of Malloy at events, strikes, and award ceremonies, and other materials.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: For the photographs, copyright is held by the photographer, often denoted on the back of the photographs. The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to additional documents. Materials are expected to enter the public domain in 2122. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Edward J. Malloy Papers; TAM 591; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: This collection was donated in 2005 by Edward J. Malloy. The accession numbers 1950.119, 2005.037 and NPA.2005.042 are associated with this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains mostly materials generated by Malloy as an executive in the Enterprise Association of Steamfitters Local Union 638 United Association and as the president of the Building and Construction Trades Council of Greater New York, from the late 1980s to 2002. The materials include day planners, diaries, expense files, some correspondence, including thank you notes from Mayor Ed Koch, pamphlets, a masters thesis by Werner Ulrich, certificates of election, badges from conventions, assignments for "Critical Thinking in Human Relations" class, and photographs. The bulk of the collection is made up of individual photographs of Malloy and group portraits of Malloy at events and with individuals including Chuck Schumer, Anthony Weiner, Hillary Clinton, Rudy Guiliani, Elizabeth H. Dole, Archbishop John Joseph O'Connor, Bill Clinton, Edmund J. Bergassi, and others. The photographs also depict building sites and strikes, some personal photographs, golf tournaments, the Boy Scouts of America 1994 Construction Industry "Good Scout Award" ceremony, a protest against New York University's construction site at 201 East 14th Street, Building and Construction Trades Council of Greater New York visit to the New York Stock Exchange, and Malloy as grand marshall of the Saint Patrick's Day Parade in 2001. The collection also contains a program from the Tenth Annual Construction and Building Industry Award Dinner-Dance, where Malloy won an award.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edward J. Malloy (1935-2012) was born and raised in New York City and attended Saint Simon Stock High School in the Bronx. Upon completing his tour of duty with the United States Army in 1957, he was assigned to the 8th Army in Korea. In 1960, he became an apprentice in the Local 638 Steamfitters union. In 1969, Malloy was elected a member of the Trade Board and subsequently a member of the Executive Board. He was appointed Director of the Steamfitting Industry in 1976. In 1979, he was elected Business Agent and in 1983 was elected president of Local 638. He was elected as president of the Building and Construction Trades Council of Greater New York in 1992 and served until 2008. His biggest accomplishment as president was the Project Labor Agreements (PLAs), which promoted measures to contain construction costs and maximize employment opportunities for union members for major public works projects. He also served as a member of the Board of Directors of Empire Blue Cross/Blue Shield, a member of the Board of Directors of the New York Building Congress, a member of the New York State Fire Code Committee, Labor Chairman of the New York Blood Center, and vice president of the New York State AFL-CIO. In 2001, he was selected as Grand Marshal of the New York City St. Patrickâ€™s Day Parade. He died on Tuesday, May 15th, 2012, at age 77.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: In 2013, loose materials were foldered, given folder titles, and arranged alphabetically. Photographs were separated from this collection during initial processing and were established as a separate collection, the Edward J. Malloy Photographs (PHOTOS 202). In 2013, the photograph collection was reincorporated into the Edward J. Malloy Papers and Photographs.
